title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Get Involved
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved           Get Involved       Whether you want to volunteer your time, donate to a cause you are passionate about, or do business with us, there are many ways you can get involved at World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument!              100 Years of the National Park Service!   The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016! We invite you to experience, learn, discover, and just have fun in national parks.        Acts of Valor   Are you a high school or college student? Create a video telling your family’s Pacific War story and submit it to our Acts of Valor project!        Saving the Mooring Quays   WWII Valor in the Pacific National Monument has received a $250,000 grant to restore a Battleship Row Mooring Quay!                    National Pearl Harbor Remembrance Day   Every year, remembrance events are held at VALR, culminating in a commemoration ceremony on December 7. Find out how you can be involved.        Volunteer at WWII Valor in the Pacific!   Volunteers-in-Parks (VIPs) work side-by-side with NPS employees. Find out how you can become a VIP!        Work With Us   NPS seeks students and professionals from numerous academic disciplines for a wide variety of internship, seasonal, and permanent positions.                    Donate to the Monument   Support the work done here, including educational initiatives, research at the USS Arizona, improving museums & visitor services, and more!        Do Business With Us   Find information about commercial filming, tour company permits, permission to hold performances on site, and other special requests.        Our Partners   Find out about our partners! Many outside organizations throughout the area help support the monument.
